alert.note: Alert for Echols (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 23 at 3:10AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern Florida and southeast Georgia, including the following areas, in northern Florida, Hamilton, Columbia, and Suwannee counties and Echols County in southeast Georgia. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a Flood Watch for northeast Florida along the I-75 corridor. Additional heavy rainfall of two to three inches is forecast, which may lead to flooding given the saturated conditions from several sequential days of heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
